text: FX402 is an open protocol for renting and licensing digital collectibles — NFTs, tickets, and media — using Coinbase’s x402 payment standard.
Instead of permanent ownership, creators can define time-based usage tiers — 1-day, 1-week, or 1-month access — all paid via x402 micro-transactions.
Built on Solana for speed and cost efficiency. Each rental payment can optionally mint a signed access receipt on-chain.
No smart-contract custody or token transfer required. FX402 runs on an honor system, using HTTP 402 payment flows and verifiable receipts.
Integrate payments directly into APIs or NFT metadata. Add `profile: r402/v1` and define tiers, prices, and rights with simple JSON.
Includes a full developer suite — JavaScript SDK (`@fx402/r402`) and Python FastAPI plugin (`fx402-fastapi`) — to handle 402 paywalls automatically.
Turn memes, art, or collectibles into economic objects. Each file becomes rentable, remixable, and revenue-sharing capable.
Agents, dapps, and creators can transact seamlessly through machine-to-machine micro-payments — the next phase of the x402 agentic economy.
Deploy instantly — no infra setup required. Works with standard web servers, Next.js APIs, and any framework supporting HTTP headers.
From temporary access passes to ticket rentals, FX402 bridges Web2 simplicity with Web3 verifiability — the universal rental layer for digital assets.
Every transaction returns a signed, portable license receipt — the user’s proof of access for a defined time window.
The mission is simple: move digital ownership from static possession to dynamic participation — rent, share, and remix on your own terms.
